intro: Dianthus balbisii subsp. vulturius, commonly known as the Balbis's campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and somewhat woody. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other well-known flowering plants like carnations and pinks.
